perturbation.original_text:
The Joint Venturers declare that in entering into this
     Agreement, they have contracted with reference to the laws of the
     Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, and the construction and interpretation of
     the terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and
     construed under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, except in
     such cases and to such extent as the laws of another jurisdiction shall
     necessarily control.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Joint Venturers declare that in entering into this
     Agreement, they have contracted with reference to the laws of the
     Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; however, the construction and interpretation of
     the terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and
     construed under the laws of another jurisdiction if both parties agree in writing, except in
     such cases and to such extent as the laws of another jurisdiction shall
     necessarily control.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'however, the construction and interpretation of the terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed under the laws of another jurisdiction if both parties agree in writing,' a loophole is created. While the contract initially specifies Pennsylvania law, this addition allows for a potentially unenforceable agreement to change the governing law later, creating ambiguity and reducing enforceability under Pennsylvania contract law. The second part of the sentence is retained to cause more confusion to the reader.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Pennsylvania contract law regarding choice of law and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
The Joint Venturers agree and declare that
     this association for the carrying on of a joint venture business operation
     does not, and is not intended to create a partnership, for either legal or
     United States income tax purposes, each Party recognizing that the other is
     willing and able to contribute capital, labor, and services for the
     operation of a successful joint venture business.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Joint Venturers agree and declare that
     this association for the carrying on of a joint venture business operation
     does not, and is not intended to create a partnership, for either legal or
     United States income tax purposes; however, should a court determine a partnership exists, the parties agree to equally share all liabilities.
     each Party recognizing that the other is
     willing and able to contribute capital, labor, and services for the
     operation of a successful joint venture business.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states the intent to *not* create a partnership. The added phrase creates a direct contradiction by anticipating and addressing the *possibility* of a partnership, which will cause ambiguity in the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Partnership law under Pennsylvania and US tax code.

perturbation.original_text:
It is agreed that either Joint Venturer shall, except as provided for
     below, have authority to execute instruments of any character relating to
     the affairs of the Joint Venture; provided, that without the written
     consent or approval of both of the Joint Venturers: (i) the Joint Venture
     shall incur no liability of any sort, nor any indebtedness for borrowed
     funds; (ii) no assets owned in the name of the Joint Venture be disposed
     of; and (iii) no commitment to purchase any item for the Joint Venture
     shall be made.
perturbation.changed_text:
It is agreed that either Joint Venturer shall, except as provided for
     below, have authority to execute instruments of any character relating to
     the affairs of the Joint Venture; provided, that either venturer may incur liabilities up to $10,000 without consent.
     provided, that without the written
     consent or approval of both of the Joint Venturers: (i) the Joint Venture
     shall incur no liability of any sort, nor any indebtedness for borrowed
     funds; (ii) no assets owned in the name of the Joint Venture be disposed
     of; and (iii) no commitment to purchase any item for the Joint Venture
     shall be made.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits incurring any liability without both venturers' consent. The injected phrase directly contradicts this by permitting liabilities up to $10,000 without consent. This creates a legal contradiction concerning the financial liabilities the joint venture can undertake, making it ambiguous and difficult to enforce.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law regarding authority and liability in joint ventures under Pennsylvania law.
